definition[0]: to stay on a particular road, course, piece of ground etc
example[0]: It’s best to keep to the paths.
definition[1]: to do what has been decided in an agreement or plan, or what is demanded by law
definition[2]: to talk or write only about the subject you are supposed to be talking about
definition[3]: to prevent an amount, degree, or level from becoming higher than it should
example[2]: Costs must be kept to a minimum.
definition[4]: to not tell anyone about something
example[3]: I’d appreciate it if you kept it to yourself.
definition[5]: to live a very quiet private life and not do many things that involve other people
definition[6]: to do what you have promised or agreed to do
example[4]: Members of staff will promote standards of conduct and will try to keep to them.
